title: Comments on the prior dependence of the DESI results
abstract:
In this short contribution, we explore the prior dependence of the recent
DESI results, according to which a Bayesian comparison of $\Lambda$CDM with
$w_0w_a$CDM cosmologies favors dynamical dark energy. It is a simple exercise
to show that extending the prior lower bound of the dark energy parameters
tilts the preference in favor of $\Lambda$CDM. Adopting the PantheonPlus
supernovae catalog, for instance, a shift of the lower bound for $w_0,w_a$ from
$-3$ to beyond $-4.6$ and $-5$, respectively, is sufficient to favor
$\Lambda$CDM. This calls for caution when interpreting DESI results in the
Bayesian context.
